AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: law enforcement agency monitoring traffic on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, familiar with local vehicles and recognizing approximately 90-95% of them as belonging to farmers and oil field workers. The agents are also aware that smaller cars seen in the area often belong to ranch owners or wind farm employees who try to avoid being followed by taking alternative routes.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan: vehicle involved in a case where it was determined to be driving in tandem with a black Dodge truck and exited off Highway 59 onto Farm-to-Market Road 2050
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Farm-to-Market Road 2050: road frequently used for drop-offs of illegal aliens to avoid checkpoints and adjacent to the Border Patrol station parking lot. The road is also used by local ranchers and oil field workers.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Agent Trevino: United States Border Patrol agent who encountered illegals in a white Malibu sedan on Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and was unaware of Corinth, Texas location at the time of stop. He also noted that smaller cars seen in the area often belong to ranch owners or wind farm employees.
